page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY- CONGRESBURY
page.content: Congresbury,on the River Yeo,lies between Bristol and Weston-S-Mare in Avon.It used to be in Somerset. {CONGERS SETTLEMENT-MYTH OR LEGEND ? St.Conger,the son of the Emperor of Constantinople,ran away from his fathers kingdom to avoid marriage. Whilst dreaming he was told by God to settle when he spied a wild boar.He fled to England and travelled to Somerset.On the moors he saw a wild boar.He settled and built a church.A settlement grew. {CONGERS MIRACLES.}1.The marshes and reed beds drained and the land became fertile. 2.Conger rested his yew staff in the churchyard,this rooted and a yew tree grew. 3.King Ince of Wessex declared the whole area a sacred place (688-726).In 975 King Edgar was hunting,he entered the sacred area, he soon died a terrible death.
